intro: Gymnosporia leptopus var. androyensis, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a succulent shrub native to the arid regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, bead-like fruits. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
